intro: Actinolepis lanosa, commonly known as the woolly actinolepis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often violet or purple in color and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained conditions.
